business.headline: Sensex tumbles 400 points, Nifty ends above 26,000 amid volatile tradeThe S&P BSE Sensex fell more than 400 points to close at 85,231, while the NSE Nifty50 managed to stay above the 26,000 mark despite broad-based weakness across sectors.

Government implements four labour codes, replacing 29 old laws. Check detailsThe move brings together decades-old labour rules that were scattered across multiple legislations into a consolidated framework. Many of these older laws date back to the pre-Independence and early post-Independence era.

Rupee slides to record low of Rs 89.45 amid US-India trade uncertaintyThe outlook for the rupee remains uncertain as global risk sentiment stays fragile and investors wait for clearer signals from both the Fed and ongoing trade negotiations between Washington and New Delhi.

Sudeep Pharma IPO fully subscribed on day 1. Check latest GMP and otherThe issue, priced between Rs 563 and Rs 593, saw a clear surge from retail and high-net-worth investors, allowing the company to cross the one-time subscription mark even though institutional participation remained weak through the first session.

How GMP and social media hype mislead so many first-time investorsThe Great IPO Gamble series ends here, and in part 3, we break down how GMP and social media hype influence first-time investors. A look at the noise behind the numbers.

Recipe for trouble? Zomato's customer data move stirs up controversyZomato controversy: Food delivery giant Zomato has decided to share customer data with restaurants after years of tussle. Politicians and marketing gurus have called it a recipe for trouble, expressing concerns about data privacy and spam messages.

Russian Oil: Reliance Halts Russian Crude Imports at Jamnagar SEZ RefineryThis report covers Reliance Industries' decision to halt the import of Russian crude oil for its export-oriented refinery in Jamnagar, Gujarat. The move is in compliance with European Union and United States sanctions targeting Russian oil majors Rosneft and Lukoil, with a wind-down period ending November 21. Reliance stated, 'we'll stay aligned with government's policy.' The company will now source crude from other regions, including West Asia and the EU, for its Special Economic Zone (SEZ) refinery, with all exports to be derived from non-Russian oil starting December 1. The decision impacts a long-term deal between Reliance and Rosneft for the supply of crude oil.

JP Power share price tumbles 7% after strong rally. Why is it down today?The JP Power share price dip reflects profit-taking after a steep run, as the market waits for clearer evidence that the broader group's restructuring will lift the company's long-term fortunes.

Groww shares jump nearly 7% after two-day tumble: What's driving today's rally?Around 10:03 am, the shares of the company were trading 6.30% higher at Rs 166.44 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). The rebound comes amid growing anticipation around Groww's performance.

Sensex, Nifty fall in early trade as hopes of US rate cut fadeAround 9:23 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was down 131 points at 85,501.03, while the NSE Nifty50 slipped 40.70 points to 26,151.45. Volatility was high in early trade and all major sectoral indices were in the red, reflecting the cautious mood on Dalal Street.

Reliance ends use of Russian crude for exports to comply with EU sanctionsReliance's decision shows how quickly the global rules around Russian oil are changing, and how Indian refiners are now being pushed to realign their supply chains.

Reliance Group says ED-attached assets belong to RCom, not part of group since 2019The ED, meanwhile, detailed its searches across Tamil Nadu in a land-forgery and inflated compensation scam involving forged deeds, dummy buyers and layered transactions, seizing and freezing assets worth Rs 18.10 crore.

Waiting for your tax refund? Here's why it's delayed and when it may arriveAccording to the Income Tax Department, more than 7.57 crore returns were filed by September 23, yet refunds for many taxpayers remain pending.

Sensex ends nearly 450 points higher, Nifty nears life-time highThe S&P BSE Sensex rose 446.21 points to close at 85,632.68, while the NSE Nifty50 climbed 139.50 points to finish at 26,192.15. Broader indices were mixed, but the tone across frontline stocks remained firmly positive, led by gains in heavyweight financial counters.

Sensex surges 500 points, Nifty nears life-time high. What's driving the rally?At 1.58 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was up 526.63 points to 85,713.10, while the NSE Nifty50 hit a fresh 52-week high and was nearing an all-time high of 26,277.

Groww share price falls 10% again: Is the post-listing rally over?Around 1:12 pm, shares of the company were trading 9.18% lower at Rs 154.30. Over the last two sessions, the stock has slipped nearly 18%, a sharp reversal that has investors wondering whether the post-listing rally has already run its course.

Leading e-commerce platforms say they now comply with anti–dark pattern rulesAmong the 26 companies listed by the CCPA are well-known names such as Flipkart, Myntra, Zomato, Swiggy, Meesho, BigBasket, JioMart and others.

The new trade playbook: Why the world needs a more distributed systemThese shifts are not driven by a single factor but by the combined influence of policy changes, supply chain lessons from recent years, and the evolving priorities of businesses and governments.

Investing Rs 5,000 every month in SIPs? This is when you can hit Rs 1 crorePeople know SIPs are useful, they hear stories of long-term gains, and they see friends investing every month, but when it comes to choosing where to put a small amount like Rs 5,000, most feel lost.

ED attaches Anil Ambani-linked assets worth Rs 1,400 crore; total nears Rs 9,000 croreThe latest attachment has been made under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA). The properties are located across Navi Mumbai, Chennai, Pune and Bhubaneswar, the sources said.

entertainment.headline: Meghan Trainor turns cyberbullying into fiery new single Still Don't Care Pop singer Meghan Trainor explores the impact of online negativity with her new single 'Still Don't Care' and announces the 'Get in Girl' tour for 2026.

Bigg Boss 19: Deepak Chahar says he's praised for sister Malti; house gets emotional Cricketer Deepak Chahar entered the 'Bigg Boss 19' house during family week, expressing pride in being known as contestant Malti Chahar's brother, while sharing light-hearted moments and stories with housemates.

Thalapathy Vijay's Jana Nayagan audio launch set for December in Malaysia The 'Jana Nayagan' audio launch will take place at Bukit Jalil Stadium in Kuala Lumpur on December 27, marking Thalapathy Vijay's return to Malaysia after three years and his last film event before retirement.

Is Shin Min Ah pregnant with Kim Woo Bin's first child? Agency responds Shin Min Ah and Kim Woo Bin will marry in a private ceremony at the Shilla Hotel in December 2025, following ten years together.  Speculations emerged that the marriage decision was prompted by a premarital pregnancy.

Shefali Shah says she was overjoyed and weeping with relief over Delhi Crime 3 Shefali Shah shared that she was "terrified" before Delhi Crime 3 dropped, unsure if the audience would accept her non-bravado side of Vartika. However, the subsequent "outpour" of love led to the actor being "overjoyed and weeping with relief."

Palash Muchhal–Smriti Mandhana wedding begins with their haldi ceremony Wedding celebrations for Indian cricket star Smriti Mandhana and composer-filmmaker Palash Muchhal began today with a vibrant Haldi ceremony attended by friends, family, and members of the Indian women's cricket team.

Piyush Mishra to Gen Z: Do your Karma, don't live a second rate life like a corpse Piyush Mishra recently appeared on Sahitya Aaj Tak 2025. In an exclusive interview, he spoke about his book 'Tumhari Aukaat Kya Hai Piyush Mishra'. He also opened up on his friendship and commented on Gen Z's obsession with social media likes.

12A Railway Colony review: Weak writing turns thriller into a twist dumpRelease Date:Fri Nov 21, 2025  '12A Railway Colony' starts with a promising setup, but the thriller quickly derails as weak writing, shallow logic and a rush of unearned twists take over.

Vilayath Budha review: Prithviraj's action thriller is flawed but entertainingRelease Date:Fri Nov 21, 2025 Vilayath Budha film review: This Prithviraj Sukumaran starrer Malayalam film has been directed by debutant Jayan Nambiar and is an entertaining action thriller that has some plot holes, but Prithvi's swag covers it up.

Chadwick Boseman honoured with Walk of Fame star, wife Simone breaks down Late actor Chadwick Boseman was posthumously honoured with a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame, with his wife Simone Ledward-Boseman, family members, and colleagues from the film industry attending an emotional ceremony in Los Angeles.

The Roses review: Benedict-Olivia are a riot in fiercely funny film that cuts deepRelease Date:Fri Nov 21, 2025 Benedict Cumberbatch and Olivia Colman shine in 'The Roses', a darkly comic, smartly observed film about modern relationships, ambition, and the messy fallout of love gone sideways. Your absolute weekend watch!

Reena Dutta thanks Aamir Khan for visiting her art exhibit Actor Aamir Khan made a public appearance at his former wife Reena Datta's art exhibition in Mumbai, highlighting their amicable relationship years after their divorce.

Why Cha Eun-woo is the internet's favourite face genius Cha Eun-woo's rise from Astro idol to global K-drama favourite is unstoppable. A look at his journey, acting highlights and why Gen Z cannot get enough of him.

Stranger Things Season 5: Release date, cast and what's coming next in Hawkins Stranger Things returns with its fifth and final season, premiering November 26 on Netflix after a three-year gap. The new season will be released in three parts and will also receive a limited theatrical release in the US. The cast returns to face a new threat in Hawkins in 1987.

'Homeless' Kevin Spacey says a call from Scorsese or Tarantino could end his woes Kevin Spacey has revealed he is officially homeless, moving between Airbnbs due to astronomical legal costs. The actor, whose home was foreclosed, stated the industry is waiting for "permission" from an authority like Martin Scorsese or Quentin Tarantino to hire him for prominent roles.

SRK and Salman visit Abu Dhabi museum, pose with giant dino fossil Bollywood icons Shah Rukh Khan and Salman Khan have made headlines with a series of high-profile joint appearances, including a recent visit to the Natural History Museum in Abu Dhabi.

Prabhas watches Baahubali The Epic at Hyderabad's Prasads Multiplex. Watch Prabhas visited Hyderabad's Prasads Multiplex to watch the re-edited 'Baahubali: The Epic'. The film's re-run has crossed nearly Rs 80 crore, marking a grand celebration of the franchise's 10th anniversary.

Mask review: Kavin, Andrea star in intriguing heist drama that doesn't fully deliverRelease Date:Fri Nov 21, 2025 Mask movie review: Directed by Vikarnan Ashok, and starring Kavin and Andrea Jeremiah, 'Mask' is a heist drama that is intriguing. While the film shows a lot of potential with its story, it is bogged down by pacing and editing issues.

Hrithik Roshan jokes about War 2 failure, admits his last film bombed at box office Hrithik Roshan recently joked about his last film's underperformance, the Spy Universe sequel 'War 2'. Introduced as a "superstar" at an event, the actor humorously countered by mentioning that his movie had "bombed at the box office," while appreciating the affection shown by the audience.

general news.headline: Indian Air Force Tejas jet crashes at Dubai Airshow, pilot diesAn Indian Air Force HAL Tejas combat aircraft crashed during a demonstration at the Dubai Airshow, triggering emergency response and concern among spectators.

Why IAF's Tejas fighter jet crashed in Dubai during air showTejas Jet Crash: Experts said the IAF pilot appeared to be executing a manoeuvre known as a barrel roll when it crashed during the Dubai Airshow.

Nitish Kumar gives up Home after 2 decades, hands it to deputy Samrat ChoudharyThe Home Department, which was with Nitish Kumar until now, has been given to Samrat Choudhary, who continues as Bihar's Deputy Chief Minister. Nitish passing on the key portfolio after two decades to his deputy signals a shift in which JD(U)'s ally, the BJP, appears to be moving toward the driving seat in Bihar.

Tejas jet crashes at Dubai Airshow a day after PIB shot down oil-leak propagandaAn Indian Air Force Tejas aircraft crashed during the Dubai Airshow while performing a manoeuvre. The IAF has ordered a court of inquiry into the incident. The crash came a day after the government's fact-check unit busted an oil-leak propaganda.

Prashant Kishor: From hero to zero or not?The political fortunes of Prashant Kishor have been the subject of much media speculation for months. The Bihar voter has delivered a resounding verdict: the Jan Suraaj Party got zero seats. Has Prashant Kishor proven to be a non-starter in the hurly-burly of electoral politics, or is it premature to write him off?

Life is fragile, literature the medium that makes bonds strong: Kalli PurieInaugurating the 8th edition of Sahitya Aaj Tak, India Today Group's Vice Chairperson Kalli Purie spoke on the importance of literature while reflecting on the unpredictability of life.

Why Vaibhav Suryavanshi didn't bat in Super Over? Jitesh Sharma explainsRising Stars Asia Cup: Jitesh Sharma explained why India A didn't send Vaibhav Suryavanshi for the Super Over in their semi-final against Bangladesh A on Friday in Doha. Suryavanshi had scored 38 off 15 balls, including two fours and four sixes, but India still crashed out of the tournament.

India Today accesses Delhi riots video of deadly attack on cop shown in courtOne of the video footages allegedly depicted a petitioner with a stick striking a CCTV camera, while another showed the incident in which Delhi Police Head Constable Ratan Lal was killed. On February 24, 2021, Lal sustained serious injuries during the clashes and was rushed to hospital, where he later died.

Video: Bikers flung into air after collision with speeding car in UttarakhandA terrifying road accident in Uttarakhand saw two young men thrown into the air after a collision with a speeding car, yet they survived with minor injuries. Another tragic incident in Chamoli district claimed two lives when a vehicle carrying wedding guests fell into a ditch.

Guwahati Test: Home pride at stake as shaky India face confident South AfricaIND vs SA, 2nd Test: India step into uncharted territory in Guwahati, battling form, injuries and rising doubts, while buoyant South Africa chase a rare series triumph on Indian soil in a historic Test showdown.

US threatens to cut support, intel to push Ukraine for peace deal: ReportThe US is pressuring Ukraine to accept a peace framework by threatening to cut intelligence and weapons support. The proposed 28-point plan includes key Russian demands, pushing Kyiv toward concessions.

A Class 4 child died by suicide. CBSE now lists 18 months of ignored warningsCBSE has issued a show cause notice to Neerja Modi School in Jaipur after a Class 4 student died by suicide following alleged bullying and major safety lapses. India Today has accessed the notice, which details 18 months of ignored bullying complaints and how the child's five repeated calls for help went unanswered in the final hour.

CGC University, Mohali: Where vision becomes legacy and education becomes evolutionStories of students who dare to dream, of educators who ignite curiosity, and of a community that chooses progress with purpose.

UK to revamp immigration rules. Will it impact Indians?The UK's Home Secretary, Shabana Mahmood, has unveiled the country's biggest immigration overhaul in 50 years, introducing an "earned settlement" system. Migrants will only be eligible for benefits and social housing once they become citizens. Here's how the new changes in the UK's immigration policy will affect Indians.

Why Nitish Kumar giving Home to BJP's Samrat Choudhary is significantDespite Nitish Kumar continuing as Chief Minister, the BJP now appears to be moving toward the driving seat. In the NDA government, Deputy Chief Minister Samrat Choudhary -positioned as number two in the cabinet - has seen his stature rise significantly.

No pollution in Delhi when seen from space. Nasa shares stunning picAccording to NASA, cities like Tokyo, Delhi, New York, Singapore, and São Paulo appear as glittering hubs of light against the planet's darker landscapes.

We could live to 100: Doctor who claimed to reverse biological age by 20 yearsDr. Michael Roizen, Chief Wellness Officer at the Cleveland Clinic, deconstructs the definition of longevity, how daily habits build our lifespan and how living to 100 could become normal.

Indians running global businesses: William Dalrymple amid Macaulay mindset debateEarlier this week, Prime Minister Narendra Modi called for a national resolve to free India from the mindset of slavery that Macaulay imposed on the country in 1835.

Meet Dev Karan, 17-year-old with a UN-backed award saving India's dying pondsSeventeen-year-old Dev Karan has won a UN-backed Young Activists Summit award for restoring India's neglected ponds through Pondora, a student-led initiative using low-cost sensors, climate literacy sessions and community stewardship. His model trains young "Pond Ambassadors" and is being recognised globally as a scalable approach to water ecosystem restoration.

Peptides are important for your skin but stacking them isn't coolYou have, probably, already heard about peptides, but the new trend is piling them in your body all together. But is this the kind of wellness cocktail you are willing to sip?

Real-life Vivah moment: Kerala man marries bride in hospital after accidentA couple from Kerala chose to wed in a hospital emergency ward after the bride suffered a spinal injury in a road accident just hours before their wedding. Despite the challenging situation, the ceremony was conducted with the support of medical staff and family members.

Man wanted for murder in India arrested in US as Canada blocks entryA 22-year-old fugitive, wanted for murder in India, was arrested by US border officials after Canada denied him entry. Vishat Kumar had been living in the US illegally under a false identity since 2024. He was detained at the Peace Bridge crossing and is now in ICE custody awaiting removal proceedings.

Video: UP doctor's dance with fiancee at hospital room viral, removed from dutyA doctor at a government hospital in UP was removed from emergency duty and his accommodation vacated after a viral video showed him dancing with his fiancee in a hospital room.

Suryakumar Yadav named in Mumbai squad for Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy Suryakumar Yadav has been named in Mumbai's 17-member squad for the 2025–26 Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy, aiming to regain form ahead of India's white-ball schedule while strengthening the defending champions.

IND vs SA live streaming, Guwahati Test: Session timings, where to watch in India India face South Africa in the second Test at Guwahati with Rishabh Pant captaining for the first time. The match features a historic tea break before lunch due to early sunset in the region.

Samson on playing with Dhoni at CSK: Destiny has brought us to same dressing room Sanju Samson expressed excitement about sharing the dressing room with MS Dhoni and contributing to CSK's future plans. The wicketkeeper batter has been traded to the five-time champions ahead of IPL 2026.

Despite Bangladesh brain fade, India crash out in Rising Stars Asia Cup semi-final India A suffered heartbreak in the Rising Stars Asia Cup semi-final at Doha, tying the match off a last-ball brain fade from Bangladesh A but ultimately losing in the Super Over. Ripon Mondal picked up two wickets in the one-over eliminator as the Tigers had the last laugh.

The Ashes: Starc reveals Usman Khawaja's back spasm triggered late batting order chaosMitchell Starc has revealed that Usman Khawaja's back spasm, suffered while he was off the field, forced a sudden reshuffle in Australia's batting order on day one of the first Ashes Test in Perth. Khawaja, unable to bat in his usual slot, arrived at No. 3 but fell cheaply as Australia collapsed to 123-9, still 49 behind England.

IND vs SA, 2nd Test Predicted 11: Who replaces Gill, Sundar to continue at No.3?India head into the 2nd Test needing a win to stay alive in the series. With Shubman Gill ruled out, major changes are expected in the batting order, including an end to the Washington Sundar No. 3 experiment. South Africa may consider bringing back Lungi Ngidi.

Silence over Perth pitch as 19 wickets fall on Day 1Ashes 2025-26: Mitchell Starc and England pacers dominated on a pace-friendly Perth pitch as 19 wickets fell on day one of the Ashes. Former Indian cricketers highlighted contrasting narratives around pitch criticism, sparking debate on fairness.

WPL 2026: Full list of players to take part in mega auctionThe WPL 2026 auction features 277 players competing for 73 slots, with 194 Indians and 83 overseas cricketers. The auction in New Delhi, will see marquee players like Deepti Sharma, Sophie Devine, and Meg Lanning lead a competitive bidding for teams.

Sundar or Sai deserve long rope at no 3, players should be given security: RahaneAjinkya Rahane has called on the Indian team management to end the frequent changes at the pivotal No.3 position, suggesting that either Sai Sudharsan or Washington Sundar should be backed with a consistent run and security to settle the batting order.

Inquiry ordered into alleged misconduct by junior women's hockey team coach: ReportThe Sports Ministry has reportedly launched an inquiry into allegations of sexual misconduct involving a coach linked to the Indian junior women's hockey team. Ben Stokes rocks Australia, 1st England captain in 43 years with Ashes 5-wicket haulAshes, 1st Test: Ben Stokes' brilliant five-wicket haul put England in command on Day 1 of the opener in Perth, making him the first England captain in 43 years to achieve the feat. His fiery spell left Australia reeling at 123/9, still 49 runs behind.

Ashes: Stokes, Starc run riot in Perth as 19 wickets tumble on dramatic Day 1Mitchell Starc and Ben Stokes put on a remarkable bowling display on Day 1 of the Ashes Test at Perth. Their performances set up a thrilling contest with 19 wickets falling on the opening day — the most on Day 1 of an Ashes Test in the past 100 years.

Earthquake halts Dhaka Test in Bangladesh, reporters run out of press boxPlay was briefly halted on day three of the second Test in Mirpur after an earthquake rattled Dhaka on Friday, shaking the commentary box and prompting Ireland's players to rush out of the dressing room and gather near the boundary rope.

IND vs SA: Kagiso Rabada ruled out of 2nd Test, Temba Bavuma confirmsSouth Africa's captain, Temba Bavuma, has confirmed that their lead pacer, Kagiso Rabada, has been ruled out of the 2nd Test against India.

Pollution woes: BCCI shifts knockout stages of key tournament from Delhi to MumbaiBCCI has relocated the men's under-23 knockout cricket matches from Delhi to Mumbai due to severe air pollution. This move aims to safeguard players' health and ensure smooth conduct of matches amid worsening smog.

WPL 2026 player auction list released: Deepti Sharma, Meg Lanning in marquee setA record 277 players have registered for the WPL 2026 Auction, more than doubling last year's numbers. With 73 slots up for grabs, franchises will look to rebuild as marquee stars including Deepti Sharma, Sophie Ecclestone, Alyssa Healy and Meg Lanning headline the November 27 auction in New Delhi.

Rishabh Pant ignores critics, ready to captain India in Guwahati TestIndia vs South Africa: Rishabh Pant, who took charge in Kolkata after Shubman Gill left the game, said he was honoured to lead India in the second Test against South Africa in Guwahati.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
